Mixing 1 mL of the supernatant, 1 mL of 50 mM potassium phosphate buffer (pH 7.0), 10 mM hydroxylamine hydrochloride, 2 mL of 7 mM α-naphthyl and 2 mL of 17 mM sulphanilic acid, and then measuring the absorbance of the pink phase at 530 nm. The O 2 – content was determined by comparison with a standard curve according to the method previously described by Hu et al.
